document.masterDocTitle: New and newly recorded species of the genus Halone Walker, 1854 (Lepidoptera Erebidae, Arctiinae, Lithosiini) from Cambodia, Laos and Vietnam

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New and newly recorded species of the genus Halone Walker, 1854 (Lepidoptera Erebidae, Arctiinae, Lithosiini) from Cambodia, Laos and Vietnam

bibRefCitation.author: Bucsek, K.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bucsek, K. (2012) Erebidae, Arctiinae (Lithosiini, Arctiini) of Malay Peninsula - Malaysia. Institute of Zoology SAS, Bratislava, 170 pp.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Halone ariadna Bucsek, 2012
,
Erebidae , Arctiinae of Malay Peninsula-Malaysia
: 85, pl. 15: 212. TL: Malay Peninsula (Cam-

Diagnosis. Length of the forewing 8˗9 mm in both sexes.
Halone ariadna Bucsek
differs from other allied species by having the thorax dark brown; white ochreous forewing with dark brown basal band; dark brown medial patch of costal area elongated horizontally; series of three dark brown terminal rounded patches ( Figs. 1a ˗d); in male genitalia ( Fig. 3 ), valva irregularly rectangular, with strongly sclerotized edge and a long (almost same length with uncus), spine˗shaped processes at the base of costa; aedeagus tapered towards weakly sclerotized distal end and vesica with two stout, spine˗shaped cornuti and scobination; in female genitalia ( Fig. 4 ), ductus bursae wrinkle, weakly sclerotized; corpus bursae ovoid, heavily covered with short spines in first half of bursae.

Type series.
CAMBODIA : 1 ♂ , 20km SE Koh Kong , Tatai river (N11˚34′, E103˚07′, Alt.:
50˗300m
),
3˗19.V.2005
(leg. E Jendek & O. Šauša ); 1 ♂ , Kirirom National Park (N11˚21′, E104˚04′, Alt. :
780m
),
17.I.
200? (leg. M. & S. Murzin , CKB)
.

1 ♂ , Pursat , Pursat Prov. (N12˚05′34.2″, E103˚11′10.1″),

( YS Bae , XV Le , DY Chae );

;

;

;

18. VI .2004
, Alt. :
40 m

Distribution. Laos ( Bolikhamsai Prov.), Vietnam (Hue Prov.), Cambodia ( Koh Kong , Mondulkiri , Pursat Prov.), Malay Peninsula (Pahang Prov.).

Remarks. This species is newly recorded in Laos ( Bolikhamsai Prov.) and Vietnam (Hue Prov.). In Cambodia , it was reported from Koh Kong Prov. by Bucsek (2012) and from Mondulkiri and Pursat Prov. by
Bae et al. (2016)
.
